intro: Malapoenna umbellata, commonly known as the Malapoenna umbellate, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, umbellate inflorescences that consist of numerous small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. Malapoenna umbellata is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight.
